document.topic_text: How Do You Compare to the Competition? Get facts about other applicants with a CareerBuilder Account Sign Up Job Description Supports the Department of Defense ( DoD ) global communications networks by managing the DoD IP Networks. Identifies and recommends solutions for continuous operation of network as capacity needs change. Plans, designs, and coordinates network changes to meet user demands. Makes corrections to network configurations to ensure efficient operation. Monitors and documents network and traffic analysis. - Will be "mission essential" and must be able to support 12, 10, or 8hrs shifts based upon requirements and resources available - Support complex network features and configurations, provide ongoing troubleshooting, recover from network outages and/or quality performance problems- Respond, troubleshoot, and resolve incidents- Monitor and report network alarms, service degradation, or loss of service- Must maintain a customer-centric focus to ensure quality customer service and support is the top priority Minimum Education and Experience Bachelor's Degree and 5 years work experience or equivalent experience - DoD 8570 IAT- level II baseline certification. This is a GSEC, Security+(CE), SSCP, CCNA-Security, CISA, GCIH, GCED, CISSP (or Associate), or CASP certification - Experience troubleshooting and configuring IP networks using at least one of the following routing methods: BGP, ISIS or OSPF, Static routing. - Experience troubleshooting either service provider or enterprise IP networks using an interface on Cisco (ESR and ASR) and/or Juniper routers. - Knowledgeable on ports and protocols. - Understanding of network topologies, both transport and IP - Ability to work in a team focused, dynamic environment - Ability to perform troubleshooting, configuration, and restoration of services across multiple platforms. Preferred Skills and Education - Cisco, Juniper, or other similar certification About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do-from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That's BAE Systems. That's Inspired Work. Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Gender Expression. To see Inspired Work in action, visit www.baesystems.com and follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/baesystemsintel. EEO Career Site Equal Opportunity Employer.
